text: A burette is a vertical tube-like instrument, used to measure and separate known amounts of liquids in laboratories. Burettes are very precise and one can measure the volume of a fluid with the precision of Â±0.05 mL with them. == History == Francois Antoine Henri Descroizilles developed the first burette on 1791.Louis Rosenfeld. Four Centuries of Clinical Chemistry. CRC Press, 1999, p. 72-75. Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac invented a more complete burette later. == References == Category:Laboratory equipment
title: Burette
